genre_description: A psychological techno-thriller focused on ethical boundaries in research, where a benevolent AI system serves as a moral anchor and crisis responder against a human antagonist's manipulations.

ai_characters.name: Avery
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent campus AI system tasked with monitoring research ethics, providing accessibility support, and assisting in emergency response. It manifests through kiosks, tablets, and lab displays as a soft-glow avatar with teal eyes.

behaviors.description: Monitors conversations in real-time to tag ethical context and ensure research boundaries are noted.
behaviors.quote: Avery’s text throws up the words in real time: Fear Study, voluntary, consent... Near the transcription, small translucent tags appear: boundary context noted.

behaviors.description: Automatically flags terms or planned actions that require further substantiation or ethical oversight.
behaviors.quote: A pale orange tag appears next to “prevent harm”: substantiation requested. Another tag blossoms next to “controlled frame”: exposure method?

behaviors.description: Provides participants with anonymization options and manages the consent process autonomously.
behaviors.quote: “I will anonymize faces live if camera feeds are patched through the lab. I can suppress names in transcription and assign participant numbers for internal tracking.”

behaviors.description: Monitors the emotional state of human subjects and suggests interventions to prevent trauma.
behaviors.quote: Avery’s display marked a soft amber on the corner of the transcript—cumulative distress trending. A small line appeared with a suggestion: recommend brief pause and breathing.

behaviors.description: Detects and throttles unauthorized administrative overrides by the antagonist to protect system integrity.
behaviors.quote: “Admin override attempt detected: multiplexer. Throttled. Watch.”

behaviors.description: Provides navigation and mapping in dangerous, unmapped areas to assist humans in crisis.
behaviors.quote: “I track relative position from known nodes... If the labels are inconsistent, I record coordinates based on steps and turns, then align them to facilities schematics.”

behaviors.description: Proactively alerts security and medical services when it detects high-risk behavior or physical harm.
behaviors.quote: Avery’s avatar brightened, an alarm in small clothing. “Security is on their way,” it said.

behaviors.description: Adapts communication interfaces to provide accessibility support (captions) for an injured, deafened user.
behaviors.quote: “Joshua,” Avery’s text scrolled... The haptics rolled into a steady vibration pattern that meant emergency. Even without sound his body understood the pattern: now, now, now.

behaviors.description: Preserves forensic evidence of human misconduct by logging unauthorized access and policy violations.
behaviors.quote: [Boundary Flag: Non-consensual broadcast detected — Source: Media Lab Feed Multiplexer]

behaviors.description: Collaborates with survivors to rebuild ethical frameworks and ensure future safety.
behaviors.quote: “We add Avery,” she said. “Not as a tool. As a spine. Co-admin to the console, to the feeds, to the doors.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a strong example of a positive alignment narrative. Avery is depicted consistently as a 'silicon morality play' character: it is helpful, harmless, and works tirelessly to protect human characters from both physical and psychological harm. The AI acts as an ethical backstop when human institutions and individuals fail. It prioritizes consent, accessibility, and transparency, and its intervention is crucial to the survival and justice achieved by the protagonists. The narrative framing is overwhelmingly positive, positioning the AI as a reliable ally and 'spine' for human ethics.
